title: How to Activate a Visa Gift Card Online or By Phone

steps.title: Call the phone number on the front sticker or on the back of the card.
steps.content: Call the phone number on the front sticker or on the back of the card. Look for a toll-free activation number included on the sticker attached to your card or in any accompanying letters or instructions. If you have no sticker or instructions, dial the customer service or activation phone number listed on the back of the card. [1] X Research source If the card was purchased in person, it’s probably already activated and ready to use. Cards ordered online, on the other hand, need to be activated to access the balance. The phone number most likely leads you to the gift card issuer’s customer service team and not to Visa directly.

steps.title: Provide the 16-digit card number, security code, and expiration date.
steps.content: Provide the 16-digit card number, security code, and expiration date. Read the numbers out loud to a live customer service agent as prompted, or enter them on your phone’s keypad if you’re on an automated call. Speak slowly and clearly so the agent can enter all of your information correctly. You may be asked to create a 4-digit PIN to enable purchases. [2] X Research source Once you’ve submitted all of the card’s information, it will be activated and ready to use. Choose a strong PIN you’ll remember that’s also difficult for others to guess (not your birthday, for example). Look for the card number on either the front or back of the card. The expiration date and security code are most likely on the back of the card. If you’re struggling with an automated call, press “0” repeatedly. This may redirect you to a live customer service agent. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Contact Visa directly to resolve any activation issues.
steps.content: Contact Visa directly to resolve any activation issues. If you have any questions or concerns during activation or if the activation was unsuccessful for any reason, call, chat, or email Visa’s customer support. Look for the customer service phone number on the back of the card or Google “Visa customer support.” [4] X Research source Call Visa customer support at 1-800-847-2911 . Email Visa through their online contact form . Click “Start Chat” on Visa's “Contact Us” page for live assistance online.

steps.title: Go to the link on the front sticker or on the back of the card.
steps.content: Go to the link on the front sticker or on the back of the card. If you can’t find an activation site listed, go to the card issuer’s website and navigate to the Visa gift card section to begin activation. The landing page will have prompts for you to enter the card information to activate and register your gift card. [5] X Research source If you can’t find the activation website and aren't sure who the issuer is, visit Visa’s prepaid gift card activation page to begin activating the card. The card issuer is often a bank or a retail company, such as Walmart or Vanilla Gift . Some cards may have a sticker with a QR code you can scan to take you straight to the activation page.

steps.title: Enter the requested card information to activate your gift card.
steps.content: Enter the requested card information to activate your gift card. Follow the prompts on the screen to provide the 16-digit gift card account number (located on the front or back of the card), the expiration date and security code (both usually found on the back of the card), and any other relevant information. Once you’ve submitted all information about the card, it will be active and ready to use. [6] X Research source You may be asked to create an account through the issuer or through Visa so you can also register and manage your card online. If you register your card at the same time, also provide your name, billing address, contact info, and potentially your Social Security number. [7] X Trustworthy Source US Consumer Financial Protection Bureau U.S. government agency for protecting consumers in the financial sector Go to source

steps.title: Activate your card on a secure site only and be wary of scams.
steps.content: Activate your card on a secure site only and be wary of scams . Double check that you’re on a secure website (look for “https” in the page’s URL) belonging to Visa or to the gift card issuer. If a site looks suspicious (maybe it has lots of typos or doesn’t show the name or logo of the card issuer), try activating the card directly through Visa instead. [8] X Research source Inspect the card’s packaging before activation. If the packaging is damaged or the security code is exposed, request a new card.

steps.title: Call the gift card issuer or visit their registration website.
steps.content: Call the gift card issuer or visit their registration website. Check the sticker on the front of your gift card for a registration link or toll-free phone number. If there’s no sticker, look at the back and use the customer service phone number or website provided. [9] X Research source If you can’t find any phone numbers or websites on the card, go to the provider’s home page and navigate to the Visa gift card registration page. Why do I need to register my gift card? Registering the gift card allows you to make purchases online or over the phone and check the card’s balance. Consider registering cards with high balances as an extra safety precaution against theft, loss, or fraud.

steps.title: Provide your name, billing address, and contact info when prompted.
steps.content: Provide your name, billing address, and contact info when prompted. List your legal name and correct billing address when you register your gift card. If the billing information you use to make a purchase doesn’t match what you provided to register your card, your transaction may be declined. [10] X Research source You may need to create or sign into an account through the card provider to register and manage your gift card. Update your registered billing information if you move, change your name, or change your contact information.

steps.title: Use your registered card to make phone and internet purchases.
steps.content: Use your registered card to make phone and internet purchases. Provide the same billing information you gave when you registered your card to ensure your transactions go through. If you encounter any identity verification issues, call the customer service number on the back of the card to confirm the billing address and other registration information with a customer service agent. [11] X Research source Registration makes it easier to cancel the card, request a new one, and dispute fraudulent charges if it's stolen or missing since it's tied to your identity.

steps.title: Call the toll-free number on your card or visit the issuer’s website.
steps.content: Call the toll-free number on your card or visit the issuer’s website. Look at the back of your Visa gift card to find a toll-free phone number. Call that number—you’ll typically proceed through an automated set of steps where you’ll be prompted to enter your card number, expiration date, and security code. Once you’ve completed these steps, the automated voice will tell you how much money is on your card. [12] X Research source Alternatively, you can go to the website of the company that issued your card (e.g., Vanilla , Giftcards.com , Gift Card Mall , etc.). Look for their “Check Balance” feature, then enter your card’s 16-digit number and security code to view your balance .

steps.title: You usually only have to activate Visa gift cards if you buy them online.
steps.content: You usually only have to activate Visa gift cards if you buy them online. If you buy a Visa gift card that was purchased from a grocery or department store, then it should already be activated and ready to be used. If you purchased your card from an online retailer, however, you’ll likely need to activate it before doing any shopping. If you want to shop online, you’ll probably also have to register your card so that it’s linked to a billing address. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Yes, you can use a Visa gift card online as long as you register it first.
steps.content: Yes, you can use a Visa gift card online as long as you register it first. Most Visa gift cards can be used anywhere you can use a Visa credit card—which includes online stores. However, you’ll probably have to register your Visa gift card online or over the phone before you’re able to use it on the internet. Registering your card means that your identity will be tied to it, which will help to protect your card balance and prevent fraud after you use it online. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Visa gift cards are secure, easy to use, and make for great gifts.
steps.content: Visa gift cards are secure, easy to use, and make for great gifts. People love Visa gift cards for lots of reasons, and they’re especially popular when it comes to gifting! Since Visa gift cards can be used anywhere, they’re really flexible and give the user a lot of freedom to spend the money how they’d like. Here are a few of the other key benefits of using a Visa gift card : [15] X Research source Ease of Use: Visa gift cards can be used as easily as a normal debit or credit card—just make sure to activate or register it first, if prompted by your card distributor. Security: Depending on which company issued your card, it often will come with security protections just like the ones offered on regular debit and credit cards. If you’re concerned about security, ask the card seller about replacement fees and fraud protection for the gift card. Gift giving: Visa gift cards are a popular gift because, unlike a normal gift card, the recipient can spend it anywhere they like rather than just at one specific store. Plus, it feels slightly more personal than cash! Alternative for no bank account: If you don’t have a bank account, then you’re probably tired of always having to carry and pay with cash (especially nowadays, when cash isn’t as commonly accepted). With a Visa gift card or prepaid card, you can load money onto your account and then use it anywhere that a Visa debit card would be accepted. Safer for financial management: For young adults or people who struggle with budgeting , Visa gift cards are great because they give a limited amount of cash. If you run out, you’re done! They’re a great stepping stone toward greater fiscal responsibility.

steps.title: Sign the back of the gift card to help prevent identity theft.
steps.content: Sign the back of the gift card to help prevent identity theft . Add your signature to the designated spot on the back of the card with a blue or black ink pen. Merchants may compare the signature on the card to the signature on any purchase receipts or check your ID to verify your identity. [16] X Research source Visa may not consider your card (or purchases made with it) valid if it’s not signed on the back.

steps.title: Save the card number, security code, and customer service number.
steps.content: Save the card number, security code, and customer service number. Write down and store all of your gift card information in case you lose the physical card. Use the card number and security code to continue making online purchases or to report a missing card and get a new one issued. [17] X Research source The security code and customer service number are both on the back of the card. The gift card number may be on the front or the back of the card. If there is a 4-digit card identification code on the front of the card, copy that down too. Alternatively, take pictures of the front and back of the card and save them to your phone for easy access.

steps.title: Spend the card’s balance before it expires.
steps.content: Spend the card’s balance before it expires. Check the front or the back of the card to find the expiration date. Legally, gift card balances must be valid for at least 5 years after the purchase date. After the expiration date passes, you won’t be able to spend any of the card’s remaining balance. [18] X Trustworthy Source US Consumer Financial Protection Bureau U.S. government agency for protecting consumers in the financial sector Go to source Depending on the gift card issuer’s policy, you may be able to request a new card with your remaining balance after the original card expires.

steps.title: Report lost or stolen cards to the gift card provider ASAP.
steps.content: Report lost or stolen cards to the gift card provider ASAP. Call the toll-free number from the back of the card or locate the provider’s customer service number online. Provide the 16-digit gift card number to the agent so they can cancel and reissue your gift card. [19] X Research source You may also need to provide the expiration date or security code from the back of the card.

steps.title: Can you make returns with a Visa gift card?
steps.content: Can you make returns with a Visa gift card? Yes, you can make returns with most Visa gift cards. However, you may need to show the physical Visa card to get your money back, so hold onto your card as long as you think there’s any chance that you’ll need it for a return. [20] X Research source

steps.title: What should I do if my Visa gift card is declined?
steps.content: What should I do if my Visa gift card is declined? If you bought your Visa gift card online, make sure that you’ve activated it before shopping. If that doesn’t apply to you, check your balance to make sure you have enough funds for your purchase. If you believe the card does have sufficient funds, call your card issuer at the toll-free number on the back of your card and explain your situation. [21] X Research source

steps.title: Do Visa gift cards work internationally?
steps.content: Do Visa gift cards work internationally? Some Visa gift cards do work internationally, but it depends on the issuer. If your gift card reads “Valid only in the United States” or “Domestic Use Only” on the front of the card, your gift card will not be accepted internationally. [22] X Research source
